prj1.CounterSingleton

Class CounterSingleton

  • java.lang.Object
    • prj1.CounterSingleton.CounterSingleton

  • public class CounterSingleton
extends java.lang.Object
    A Singleton that can be used to count. This implementation is not thread safe.
    Author:
    ip

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCount()
      Returns the current count
      static CounterSingleton getInstance()
      Static method to create instance of CounterSingleton class.
      boolean increaseCounter()
      Increases the current count by 1.
      boolean increaseCounter(int step)
      Increases the current count by step.
      void resetCounter()
      Resets the internal counter to zero

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static CounterSingleton getInstance()
        Static method to create instance of CounterSingleton class. External code must call this method in order to get an instance of this class
        Returns:
        CounterSingleton instance

      • resetCounter

        public void resetCounter()
        Resets the internal counter to zero

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Returns the current count
        Returns:
        the current count

      • increaseCounter

        public boolean increaseCounter()
        Increases the current count by 1. Returns always true so that it can be used in boolean statements
        Returns:
        always true

      • increaseCounter

        public boolean increaseCounter(int step)
        Increases the current count by step. Returns always true so that it can be used in boolean statements. Step could be negative. It is up to the specific usage scenario whether this is desirable or not.
        Parameters:
        step - The amount to increase the counter
        Returns:
        always true
